There's a spot halfway through the movie where it seems like subtitles could really be necessary. I couldn't find any individually downloadable ones out there yet so I'm working on translating. I'll have something up soon for the first important sub moment (the others are just of the "one month later" variety, near the beginning of the movie) and will stop to give further translation updates if they happen again. Or until someone can link me to an English sub file, lol.

And Teddy I hope you weren't talking to me; I'm thrilled with the torrent and said it was worth the wait.

48:54 ENGLISH SUBTITLES, POSSIBLE SPOILERS

 (Literal translation. Interpret how you will.)


-Are you badly hurt?

-You know sign language?

-I'm an orangutan from the circus.

...

Beware of people. Don't like clever monkeys.

^ I have 30 minutes left in the film and no one has "gone to the snack bar".




1:05:15 ENGLISH SUBTITLES- POSSIBLE SPOILERS

(Translated literally. Interpret how you will).



-Why cookies rocket?

-A monkey...weak.
Monkeys together - a force.

...

-Stupid monkey.

Okay, thankfully that's it for the subtitled dialogue scenes.

Sorry of any of you are annoyed by all my comments but I just wanted to be helpful and make sure no one missed anything. Also, now that I'm finished with the movie, I want to assure any new downloaders that there's no audience noise and aside from a second at the very beginning, nothing obscuring any of the screen at any time.

Loved the torrent, loved the movie. Thanks again zaq2qaz. Totally satisfied.

Adding these trackers may not always result in increased speeds, but it sure does not hurt in this case. As said, in my case it directly resulted in faster download speeds, and the increased speed may not exactly be anything "to write home about either"- at least until this torrent gets maybe a few thousand more connecting (which no doubt it will soon).

I can not understand the members that complain of the quality of this. I watched it on a 46 inch TV via my Pc and VLC Media Player and I would say the video is in-between VHS tape and Dvd quality. Audio at 128kbps is fine for most any movie.

So, the quality is the BEST I have ever seen in about a full decade from a Cam (video). Also as said, the audio sync is right on the money with no background noise, just the audio of the movie. I would say this is actually worth burning to Disc as I can not see a normal DVD Rip being much better than this.
